comment.author: 46696233@N00
comment._content: That's James "Jimmie" Ward www.earlyaviators.com/eward1.htm Considering that by mid 1912 Ward was arrested on bigamy charges and Grant lost a battle with Cancer, I would date this pic at 1911.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
More Bain/LOC photos of Aviator James "Jimmie" Ward on Governor's Island, September 13, 1911:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163688606/in/photostream/]

Receiving a sendoff from Governors Island resident General Frederick Dent Grant:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163688086/in/photostream/]
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2162739645/in/photostream/]

Taking off on his [aborted] transcontinental flight, pursuing the Hearst prize:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163541174/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 68439219@N06
comment._content:
James J. Ward  Aero Club of America Pilot # 52  August 8, 1911
September 30, 1912  Chicago, Il.  Freed in municipal court  from bigamy charge brought by his wife , Maude Manger Ward.  In May 1912, she had charged Ward with having married Margaret Warner in 1909.She refused to prosecute, saying the evidence that Ward was married twice was merely hearsay ( Washington Post Oct. 1 , 1912)
